page.title: 06Buddens Skylark Coaches
page.content: This is a family business taken over from the carrier Mr.H.Pragnell in 1926 -then it had two buses, one a Vulcan with solid tyres.Seats were removed for goods and a crate fitted to the rear for chickens. To-day Mr.P.Budden and family have 28 coaches based on three depots at West Tytherley,Romsey and Woodfalls.An international service is provided for holiday makers travelling to most parts of Europe including Moscow.'Pop groups' are taken on tour.Coaches are run for local and National events.In school terms pupils are transported daily to school and often to swimming pools,such as Andover. To this day the coaches continue to serve the village of West Tytherley with a service to Salisbury, as the carrier did in the past.
